result.markdown:
--- title: "Linear models" --- ## Learning objectives - list the assumptions of the linear model and understand their meaning; - use graphical diagnostic tools to validate the model assumptions. - interpret the coefficients of the log-linear model on a meaningful scale; - conceptualize the notion of collinearity and understand its impacts on statistical inference. ## Content - Course notes: chapter [4 (Linear regression models)](https://lbelzile.github.io/math60604a/linearmodels.html), Sections 4.7--4.8. ## In class - [Slides](../slides/MATH60604A-slides6a.html) ([pdf](../slides/MATH60604A-slides6a.pdf) and [code](MATH60604A-slides6a.R)) - [Exercise on diagnostic plots](../exercises/graphical-diagnostics.qmd) ## After class - Watch the video of @sec-videos - [Slides on colinearity](../slides/MATH60604A-slides6b.html) ([pdf](../slides/MATH60604A-slides6b.pdf) and [code](MATH60604A-slides6b.R)) - Exercises 2.4, 2.5, 2.9, 2.10 ## Slides

## Videos {#sec-videos} There's a set of videos that walks through each section below. To make it easier for you to jump around the video examples, I cut the long video into smaller pieces and included them all in [one YouTube playlist](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLUB8VZzxA8ItMV0PT6lSI6t8Kf-YBPBjj). - [Colinearity](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JT61hD0HIvA&list=PLUB8VZzxA8ItMV0PT6lSI6t8Kf-YBPBjj) You can also watch the playlist (and skip around to different sections) here:
